fields.description: TestJobListCache#testEviction often needs more than 1000 ms to finish in Windows environment. Increasing the timeout solves the issue.
fields.summary: TestJobListCache#testEviction sometimes fails on Windows with timeout

This message was automatically generated.

Sure, 5000 ms should be enough.

I ran the test 10 times on a Windows VM with these results:
1. 1199 ms
2. 2289 ms
3. 1246 ms
4. 884 ms
5. 1122 ms
6. 1061 ms
7. 1173 ms
8. 1035 ms
9. 1046 ms
10. 1201 ms
Thanks [~GergelyNovak] for updating the patch. +1 on 002 patch, will commit it after Jenkins report.

I have commit the patch to trunk and branch-2. Thanks [~GergelyNovak] for delivering the patch and congratulation for the first patch contribution to Apache Hadoop!

FAILURE: Integrated in Hadoop-trunk-Commit #9567 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/9567/])
MAPREDUCE-6670. TestJobListCache#testEviction sometimes fails on Windows (junping_du: rev de96d7c88a42cd54bd88ce2de63122998e967efa)
* hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-hs/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/mapreduce/v2/hs/TestJobListCache.java
[~djp], can this be put on older releases too - 2.8.x, 2.7.x etc?
Sure. I will backport it to 2.7 and 2.8.
Closing the JIRA as part of 2.7.3 release.
